GT.content: pièce & “title” could give the title to any possible discourse on gift, any possible gift
GT.linkedContent: pièce & “title” could give the title to any possible discourse on gift, any possible gift

GT.content: Baudelaire’s “Counterfeit Money,” its play w/ title, links literature to belief, credit, thus capital, economy, politics
GT.linkedContent: Baudelaire’s “Counterfeit Money,” its play w/ title, links literature to belief, credit, thus capital, economy, politics

GT.content: a “true” corpus is still, perhaps, counterfeit money, may be ghost or spirit, spirit of body & of capital (title, heading, is capital), no problem of canon if this institution were natural
GT.linkedContent: a “true” corpus is still, perhaps, counterfeit money, may be ghost or spirit, spirit of body & of capital (title, heading, is capital), no problem of canon if this institution were natural

LOBL.content: Blanchot’s Death Sentence, “title runs wild and drives the reader mad”
LOBL.linkedContent: Blanchot’s Death Sentence, “title runs wild and drives the reader mad”

LOBL.content: [literary] title is not its own telos, not self-mirroring, writing prevents reflecting representation from folding back on itself

BL.content: “Before the Law” : the meta-structure of the title itself
BL.linkedContent: “Before the Law” : the meta-structure of the title itself

BL.content: title is part of literature but heterogeneous to text because of its legal authority
BL.linkedContent: title is part of literature but heterogeneous to text because of its legal authority

BL.content: from title to incipit [re: Vor dem Gesetz], 2 moments, repetition, the same > dividing of letter, “it [the repetition itself] splits the boundary by dividing its line”

HASD.content: every title has the import of a promise

PAS.content: endless dissemination in Blanchot’s Le pas au-déla > just what, so some other thing, than what comes to the title as title

DS.content: title—capital: carries its head too high, raises its voice, drowns out ensuing text
DS.linkedContent: title—capital: carries its head too high, raises its voice, drowns out ensuing text

DS.content: what ruins the “pious capital letter,” the aplomb of the heading: the blanks, ordered return of white spaces, measure & order of dissemination, law of spacing, rhythmos, invisible fleuron
DS.linkedContent: what ruins the “pious capital letter,” the aplomb of the heading: the blanks, ordered return of white spaces, measure & order of dissemination, law of spacing, rhythmos, invisible fleuron

DS.content: suspended lustre of title: title provides a first fold, highlights womb-like matrix of page, a germinal or seminal blank, “the perpetual suspense of a tear that can never be entirely formed nor fall (still the lustre) scintillates in a thousand glances”
DS.linkedContent: suspended lustre of title: title provides a first fold, highlights womb-like matrix of page, a germinal or seminal blank, “the perpetual suspense of a tear that can never be entirely formed nor fall (still the lustre) scintillates in a thousand glances”

DS.content: graft/graph (both from graphion, writing implement, stylus) — bridge graft; capital title as scion/graft (can’t tell whether its present or absent anymore)
DS.linkedContent: graft/graph (both from graphion, writing implement, stylus) — bridge graft; capital title as scion/graft (can’t tell whether its present or absent anymore)

WAP.content: privilege of title, capital, capital letter, folded up (repliée): capitalizes its meanings in its folds: able to dispense w/ sentence, w/ making itself explicit > we should begin by decapitalizing (employ/deploy significations)
WAP.linkedContent: privilege of title, capital, capital letter, folded up (repliée): capitalizes its meanings in its folds: able to dispense w/ sentence, w/ making itself explicit > we should begin by decapitalizing (employ/deploy significations)

WAP.content: privilege from its unicity, its place > its privilege is legal & authorized
WAP.linkedContent: privilege from its unicity, its place > its privilege is legal & authorized

WAP.content: keeps quiet while making us think it has a lot to say
WAP.linkedContent: keeps quiet while making us think it has a lot to say

WAP.content: institution of title/work can be incarnated by people, even single person: but this incarnation guaranteed by some institution > institution guards, guarantees title, thus already holds title; origin of power to entitle/accredit can never be phenomenalized; this not merely circle makes us rethink “repression,” “suppression,” “sacrifice”
WAP.linkedContent: institution of title/work can be incarnated by people, even single person: but this incarnation guaranteed by some institution > institution guards, guarantees title, thus already holds title; origin of power to entitle/accredit can never be phenomenalized; this not merely circle makes us rethink “repression,” “suppression,” “sacrifice”

WAP.content: a community (being-with, being-together, meeting, gathering) always presupposed in word/concept “title”
WAP.linkedContent: a community (being-with, being-together, meeting, gathering) always presupposed in word/concept “title”

WAP.content: title, titulus (inscription, certificates of genealogy), tiō, timaō (estimate, honor, valorize), timē (evaluation, estimate, price attached to someone, reward) or ci (connection)
WAP.linkedContent: title, titulus (inscription, certificates of genealogy), tiō, timaō (estimate, honor, valorize), timē (evaluation, estimate, price attached to someone, reward) or ci (connection)

WAP.content: title only has meaning virtual sentences (phrases) could give it, it gets its authority (both silent and intarissable) by capitalizing (summoning/repressing) on these virtualities
WAP.linkedContent: title only has meaning virtual sentences (phrases) could give it, it gets its authority (both silent and intarissable) by capitalizing (summoning/repressing) on these virtualities

WAP.content: title: most artificial/deceitful place in language
the definite article in title “The Crisis in the Teaching of Philosophy” would mean one can identify it, legitimacy of a topos [but crisis is a problem of limits, borders, etc.]
WAP.linkedContent: the definite article in title “The Crisis in the Teaching of Philosophy” would mean one can identify it, legitimacy of a topos [but crisis is a problem of limits, borders, etc.]

DPi.content: w/out title, head (chef), capital: a text is an outlaw, decapitated (w/ neither head nor tail [PP p. 79])

PJP.content: the 3 meanings of Le Parjure, each haunts each other, raises the # of titles (3+n): 1) the novel itself [“Counterfeit Money”], narrator betrays truth confided in him 2) betrayal, unfulfilled promise of hero of novel 3) the legal perjury, le parjure committed by le parjure
PJP.linkedContent: the 3 meanings of Le Parjure, each haunts each other, raises the # of titles (3+n): 1) the novel itself [“Counterfeit Money”], narrator betrays truth confided in him 2) betrayal, unfulfilled promise of hero of novel 3) the legal perjury, le parjure committed by le parjure

C.content: when there’s # in the title: corrupts the authority of the name, voice, phonetic writing
C.linkedContent: when there’s # in the title: corrupts the authority of the name, voice, phonetic writing

C.content: cartouche: puts itself to work, forms part of the work by inscribing (itself) (as) the title, signature, autobiographical performative of the signatory
C.linkedContent: cartouche: puts itself to work, forms part of the work by inscribing (itself) (as) the title, signature, autobiographical performative of the signatory

C.content: that which is entitled Cartouches is itself a series of cartouches, the title describes place, structure, form of text: voici des cartouches, ceux que je suis [follow/am] [cf. “Counterfeit Money”]
C.linkedContent: that which is entitled Cartouches is itself a series of cartouches, the title describes place, structure, form of text: voici des cartouches, ceux que je suis [follow/am] [cf. “Counterfeit Money”]

C.content: I am myself cartouche and cartouches(s) in the plural: “I” sign myself to death as soon as there’s the title, reduce myself to first heading, capital, shrunken head
